result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating with Prohibited Alcohol Concentration - 2nd Offense [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating a Motor Vehicle While Intoxicated - 2nd Offense [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating with Prohibited Alcohol Concentration - 2nd Offense [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating a Motor Vehicle While Intoxicated - 2nd Offense [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Steven Matthew Fee was found guilty of Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Steven Matthew Fee was found guilty of Operating with Prohibited Alcohol Concentration - 2nd Offense [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent.  In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to provide DNA sample.  Apology letter to victim.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED if defendant completes 80 hours of community service during the first 8 months of probation.
To be completed during the first 8 months of probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent.    In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Any vehicles titled in the Defendant's name and/or any vehicles operated by the Defendant are subject to an ignition interlock device.  The ignition interlock requirement becomes effective when the Defendant applies for a license.

miscConds.notes: Fine and costs to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per week via wage assignment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample.    Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant to report on or before 7/1/15 at 12:00 noon.  Defendant may have huber (48 hour confinement requirement has been fulfilled as defendant has 4 days credit).
